page.title: 01Horton in Ribblesdale
page.content: The village of Horton in Ribblesdale is dominated on the East by the hill of Penyghent, rising above the limestone outcrops and moorland dotted with sheep. Beef cattle and sheep graze in the small fields surrounded by dry-stone walls in the valley bottom. To the West, the hillside has been blasted away by the quarry presenting a huge limestone cliff face. The Norman church, the inn and the station are the focal points of this scattered community, with outlying hamlets and farms. Alongside the River Ribble runs the Settle-Carlisle railway line, now under threat of closure. Many visitors come to this village walking the 'Three Peaks' and the Pennine Way. They will appreciate the rugged scenery but not understand the problems of life in this remote area.
